item.title: Report X-2024051864
item.description:
Report X-2024051864

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was located in the belly of trailer 819739 while unloading in the preload sort. Package was found lying on its side and wet on one side. Package handler called for a damage hazmat and QA removed the package from the unload and secured it in a hazardous waste tote and transferred it to stations hazmat cage. It was discovered upon inspection that one of the caps to the bottles was leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024051618
item.description:
Report X-2024051618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-27
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on a cart at the end of a conveyor belt near a load door sitting upright with wet torn spots on outer box. When inspected, 1 cap was missing. Another was bent and came off easily. 1 was nearly empty and another was slightly below the full line. The other 2 were mostly full but the caps were not completely tight. All 4 bottles were soiled by the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024051554
item.description:
Report X-2024051554

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was brought to AM QA on the 28th even though this happened on the 24th due to the status code - 06 = refused due to "damage". PM QA missed, was unaware, or simply did not process this package accordingly. The one of four Methanol Plastic 1 gallon jug had a loose cap causing internal leakage thus soiling/staining the package plus the other products within. There was no inner packaging within.

item.title: Report X-2024051139
item.description:
Report X-2024051139

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED TO THE CLERK'S AREA FOR SOME BROKEN GLASS. RESPONDER IMMEDIATELY WENT TO THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE A HAZMAT. FROM THERE A 15FT HOTZONE WAS CREATED, ALL APPROPRIATE PPE WAS WORN AND THE SPILL CART WAS FULL PRIOR TO ARRIVAL. THE DECISION TREE WAS FOLLOWED
